title: Highest reliance on foreign aid
description: In 2020, Somalia received net official development assistance (ODA) amounting to 16588979.0382301% of its central government expenses, indicating a high reliance on foreign aid.

title: Complete multilateral debt service
description: In 2023, 100% of Somalia's public and publicly guaranteed debt service was multilateral, indicating a complete reliance on multilateral debt service.

title: Highest agricultural water use
description: In 2021, 99.48% of Somalia's total freshwater withdrawals were used for agriculture, highlighting the country's dependence on agriculture for water use.

title: Lowest domestic water use
description: In 2021, only 0.45% of Somalia's total freshwater withdrawals were used for domestic purposes, indicating minimal domestic water consumption.

title: Lowest government revenue
description: In 2023, Somalia's revenue excluding grants was only 0.00011% of GDP, indicating extremely low government revenue generation.

title: Highest import duties reliance
description: In 2023, 67.57% of Somalia's tax revenue came from customs and other import duties, showing a heavy reliance on import duties for tax revenue.

title: Lowest tax revenue
description: In 2023, Somalia's tax revenue was only 0.00008% of GDP, indicating extremely low tax collection.

title: Lowest government expense
description: In 2023, Somalia's government expenses were only 0.00023% of GDP, indicating minimal government spending.

title: Lowest trademark applications
description: In 2021, Somalia had only 140 nonresident trademark applications, indicating low levels of trademark activity.

title: Lowest property rights rating
description: In 2023, Somalia received a CPIA property rights and rule-based governance rating of 1, the lowest possible score, indicating weak property rights.

title: Lowest customs efficiency
description: In 2022, Somalia's logistics performance index for customs clearance efficiency was 1.5, indicating low efficiency in customs processes.

title: Lowest logistics competence
description: In 2022, Somalia's logistics performance index for logistics services competence was 1.8, indicating low quality of logistics services.

title: Lowest external balance
description: In 2023, Somalia's external balance on goods and services was -162215385473200 constant LCU, indicating a significant trade deficit.

title: Highest particulate emission damage
description: In 2021, particulate emission damage in Somalia was 7.09% of GNI, indicating significant environmental impact from emissions.

title: Lowest rule of law
description: In 2023, Somalia's rule of law estimate was -2.21, indicating very weak adherence to the rule of law.

title: Lowest regulatory quality
description: In 2023, Somalia's regulatory quality percentile rank lower bound was 0.47, indicating very poor regulatory quality.

title: Lowest preprimary enrollment
description: In 2021, only 1.15% of children in Somalia were enrolled in preprimary education, indicating very low early childhood education participation.

title: Lowest primary education attainment
description: In 2022, only 15.5% of Somalia's population aged 25+ had completed primary education, indicating low educational attainment.

title: Lowest primary school enrollment
description: In 2023, only 21.2% of children in Somalia were enrolled in primary school, indicating low primary education participation.

title: Lowest secondary school enrollment
description: In 2023, only 3.29% of children in Somalia were enrolled in secondary school, indicating very low secondary education participation.

title: Lowest prenatal care coverage
description: In 2019, only 31.1% of pregnant women in Somalia received prenatal care, indicating low access to maternal health services.

title: Lowest skilled birth attendance
description: In 2019, only 31.9% of births in Somalia were attended by skilled health staff, indicating low access to skilled birth care.

title: Highest female genital mutilation prevalence
description: In 2020, 99.2% of females in Somalia were affected by female genital mutilation, indicating extremely high prevalence.

title: Lowest health expenditure per capita
description: In 2022, Somalia's current health expenditure per capita was only $15.35, indicating very low health spending.

title: Highest undernourishment prevalence
description: In 2022, 51.3% of Somalia's population was undernourished, indicating a severe food security issue.

title: Lowest contraceptive prevalence
description: In 2019, only 0.9% of married women in Somalia used any modern contraceptive method, indicating very low contraceptive use.

title: Highest fertility rate
description: In 2023, Somalia's fertility rate was 6.13 births per woman, indicating a high birth rate.

title: Lowest birth registration
description: In 2020, only 7.2% of urban births in Somalia were registered, indicating very low birth registration rates.

title: Highest imports from outside region
description: In 2023, 75.32% of Somalia's merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies outside its region, indicating a high level of external trade.

title: Highest exports to Arab World
description: In 2023, 90.84% of Somalia's merchandise exports were to economies in the Arab World, indicating strong trade ties with the region.
